Title:
Phylogenetic relationship and evolution of Neodidymelliopsis
isolates collected from Iran
Keywords:
Didymellaceae, Divergence time, Fossil calibration,
Pleosporales, Secondary calibration
Abstract:
Neodidymelliopsis is a novel genus, which was recently
reported from Iranian citrus orchards. Neodidymelliopsis belongs to
Didymellaceae, a large and important family of Dothideomycetes, in the
Pleosporales. There are a few studies on molecular dating of Ascomycetes
but none of which resolved the divergence time of Didymellaceae genera.
The most important obstacle to molecular dating of fungi is the rarity
of fossils. In the present study, besides an existing reliable fossil
associated to Pleosporales, we used the estimated age of Dothidiomycetes
in another study as a secondary calibration and also a second fossil to
calibrate Capnodiales as the out-group. The dating is based on five
genetic regions of 74 taxa from the orders Capnodiales and Pleosporales,
using the Bayesian-based BEAST program. The selected taxa of
Pleosporales consist of Aigialaceae and Didymellaceace including three
newly discovered Neodidymelliopsis sp. isolates and one isolate of
Didymella from Iran. We dated the Didymellaceace and some of its genera
including Neodidymelliopsis back to the Eocene, the Didymella
specifically the Iranian isolate to the Late Oligocene and the youngest
Didymellecaea genus, Paraboeremia to the Late Pliocene.
